answers.answer: I had a liver biopsy about ten years ago and I was put out for it to be done.  They take a sliver to do a biobsy on but I hear if you do it without anesthesia that it is VERY painful.  I had a uterin biopsy without anesthesia and believe me, I almost came off the table because of the pain.  Good luck!!

Some liver lesions are benign -- you said your doctor is 99% sure, but what exactly did he call it? Did he say anything specific about the tumor?  In certain situations, biopsy may be appropriate, but in some instances it's important to know it can do more harm than good.  Did your doctor recommend against biopsy, or did he suggest one?As far as the liver biopsy itself, if you have no bleeding issues it is considered a relatively safe procedure.  My husband underwent one a few years ago, and it was done with sedation -- he was not "out," but sleepy, and didn't feel any pain during or after.  Hope that helps.  ~eureka
